Key Match Events: The Lakers lost 124-107 to the Minnesota Timberwolves
The Lakers' frontcourt competed before losing 38-41 in the rebounding battle
The Lakers had 21 turnovers, five more than Minnesota's
Pre-Game Insights: Coach JJ Redick promised to run more sets for the team
Redick said he would inevitably cede playmaking calls to LeBron James and Austin Reaves in certain situations
Post-Match Reflections: Coach JJ Redick was happy with how his team competed but noted they were 'destroyed in the possession battle'
Redick encouraged by how his players competed, even when they went down big early
Miscellaneous Highlights: The size difference was obvious when the Timberwolves opened with Rudy Gobert and Naz Reid
The Lakers kept running sets until the game was over
Players knew their roles and did as asked
Others: The Lakers played without LeBron James and Anthony Davis, while the Timberwolves didnâ€™t have Anthony Edwards and the newly acquired Julius Randle
